title.narrative: Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Project

description.narrative: Cabo Verde II - Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Project: The $41.0 million Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) Project is designed to establish a financially sound, transparent and accountable institutional basis for the delivery of water and sanitation services to Cabo Verdean households and businesses.

title.narrative: Cabo Verde II STAR Report: Full Program Lifecycle Report
Improving water and sanitation in Cabo Verde
Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene

condition.narrative: Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

a) Prior to making the first tranche (US$5 million) of MCC Funding available under the Infrastructure Grant Facility: (i) the operations manual for the Infrastructure Grant Facility shall have been approved by MCA-Cape Verde II and MCC; and (ii) ANAS shall have been created and CNAS shall have adopted the strategic Master Plan.

b) Prior to making the second tranche (US$10 million) of MCC Funding available under the Infrastructure Grant Facility, Aguas de Santiago shall have been created as an independent, corporatized entity that is subject to the regulatory jurisdiction of ARE and ARE will have in place a tariff mechanism that is based on cost-of-service by rate class and which addresses pro-poor tariffs.

c) The amount of MCC Funding disbursed in the third tranche of the Infrastructure Grant Facility, shall at no time exceed the total amount of Government and third party firm commitments of funding by the Government or other donors to the Infrastructure Grant Facility, as reported in connection with the Country Contribution schedule set for in Annex 3; provided that the expenditures made pursuant to such commitments are reasonably expected to be made prior to the expiration of the Compact Term

title.narrative: Value of time spent fetching water per week on Santiago Island (Female - Urban)
